intro: Rompelia polymorpha, commonly known as the variable rompelia, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Rompelia polymorpha is often found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and riverbanks.
